metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.html: SVG elements can be animated.

content.text: In SVG, we have four animation elements which sets or animates SVG graphics:
content.html: In SVG, we have four animation elements which sets or animates SVG graphics:

content.text: The <set> element sets the value of an attribute for a specified duration.
content.html: The <set> element sets the value of an attribute for a specified duration.

content.text: In this example, we create a red circle that starts with a radius of 25, then after 3 seconds the radius will be set to 50:
content.html: In this example, we create a red circle that starts with a radius of 25, then after 3 seconds the radius will be set to 50:
Here is the SVG code:

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<circle cx="50" cy="50" r="25" style="fill:red;">
  <set attributeName="r" 
to="50" begin="3s" />
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="25" style="fill:red;">
  <set attributeName="r" to="50" begin="3s" />
</svg>

content.html: Code explanation:

content.text: The <animate> element animates an attribute of an element.
content.html: The <animate> element animates an attribute of an element.

content.text: The <animate> element should be nested inside the target element.
content.html: The <animate> element should be nested inside the target element.

content.text: In this example, we create a red circle. We animate the cx attribute from 50 to 90%. This means that the circle will go from left to right:
content.html: In this example, we create a red circle. We animate the cx attribute from 50 to 90%. This means that the circle will go from left to right:
Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<animate      attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" />

attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" /

content.code:
<svg width="100%" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<circle cx="50" cy="50" r="50" style="fill:red;">
    
<animate      attributeName="cx"      
begin="0s"      dur="8s"
from="50"      to="90%"
repeatCount="indefinite" />
  </circle>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<animate      attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" />

attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" /

content.code_html:
<svg width="100%" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="50" style="fill:red;">
    <animate
      attributeName="cx"
      begin="0s"
      dur="8s"
      from="50"
      to="90%"
      repeatCount="indefinite" />
  </circle>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<animate      attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" />

attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" /

content.html: Code explanation:

content.text: In this example, we want the red circle to freeze (stop) when it comes to its final position (instead of snapping back to the start position):
content.html: In this example, we want the red circle to freeze (stop) when it comes to its final position (instead of snapping back to the start position):
Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<animate      attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  fill="freeze" />

attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  fill="freeze" /

content.code:
<svg width="100%" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<circle cx="50" cy="50" r="50" style="fill:red;">
    
<animate      attributeName="cx"      
begin="0s"      dur="8s"
from="50"      to="90%"
fill="freeze" />
  </circle>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<animate      attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  fill="freeze" />

attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  fill="freeze" /

content.code_html:
<svg width="100%" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="50" style="fill:red;">
    <animate
      attributeName="cx"
      begin="0s"
      dur="8s"
      from="50"
      to="90%"
      fill="freeze" />
  </circle>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<animate      attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  fill="freeze" />

attributeName="cx"      
  begin="0s"      dur="8s"      
  from="50"      to="90%"      
  fill="freeze" /

content.html: Code explanation:

content.text: The <animateTransform> element animates the transform attribute on the target element.
content.html: The <animateTransform> element animates the transform attribute on the target element.

content.text: The <animateTransform> element should be nested inside the target element.
content.html: The <animateTransform> element should be nested inside the target element.

content.text: In this example, we create a red rectangle that will rotate:
content.html: In this example, we create a red rectangle that will rotate:
Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<animateTransform      attributeName="transform"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  type="rotate"      from="0 85 85"      
  to="360 85 85"      repeatCount="indefinite" />

attributeName="transform"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  type="rotate"      from="0 85 85"      
  to="360 85 85"      repeatCount="indefinite" /

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="180" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect 
x="30" y="30" height="110" width="110" style="stroke:green;fill:red">
    
<animateTransform      attributeName="transform"      
begin="0s"      dur="10s"
type="rotate"      from="0 85 85"
to="360 85 85"      repeatCount="indefinite" />
  
</rect>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<animateTransform      attributeName="transform"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  type="rotate"      from="0 85 85"      
  to="360 85 85"      repeatCount="indefinite" />

attributeName="transform"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  type="rotate"      from="0 85 85"      
  to="360 85 85"      repeatCount="indefinite" /

content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="180" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect x="30" y="30" height="110" width="110" style="stroke:green;fill:red">
    <animateTransform
      attributeName="transform"
      begin="0s"
      dur="10s"
      type="rotate"
      from="0 85 85"
      to="360 85 85"
      repeatCount="indefinite" />
  </rect>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<animateTransform      attributeName="transform"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  type="rotate"      from="0 85 85"      
  to="360 85 85"      repeatCount="indefinite" />

attributeName="transform"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  type="rotate"      from="0 85 85"      
  to="360 85 85"      repeatCount="indefinite" /

content.html: Code explanation:

content.text: The <animateMotion> element sets how an element moves along a motion path.
content.html: The <animateMotion> element sets how an element moves along a motion path.

content.text: The <animateMotion> element should be nested inside the target element.
content.html: The <animateMotion> element should be nested inside the target element.

content.text: In this example, we create a rectangle and a text. Both elements have an <animateMotion> element with the same path:
content.html: In this example, we create a rectangle and a text. Both elements have an <animateMotion> element with the same path:
Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<animateMotion      path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 
  q60,-20 100,0"      begin="0s"      
  dur="10s"      repeatCount="indefinite" />

path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 
  q60,-20 100,0"      begin="0s"      
  dur="10s"      repeatCount="indefinite" /

<animateMotion      
  path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 q60,-20 100,0"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" />

path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 q60,-20 100,0"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" /

content.code:
<svg width="100%" height="150" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect 
x="45" y="18" width="155" height="45" style="stroke:green;fill:none;">
    
<animateMotion      path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 
q60,-20 100,0"      begin="0s"
dur="10s"      repeatCount="indefinite" />
  
</rect>
  <text x="50" y="50" 
style="font-family:Verdana;font-size:32">It's SVG!
    <animateMotion      
path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 q60,-20 100,0"
begin="0s"      dur="10s"
repeatCount="indefinite" />
</text>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<animateMotion      path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 
  q60,-20 100,0"      begin="0s"      
  dur="10s"      repeatCount="indefinite" />

path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 
  q60,-20 100,0"      begin="0s"      
  dur="10s"      repeatCount="indefinite" /

<animateMotion      
  path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 q60,-20 100,0"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" />

path="M0,0 q60,100 100,0 q60,-20 100,0"      
  begin="0s"      dur="10s"      
  repeatCount="indefinite" /
